title: I'm.....disappointed.
body:
The Vlad update...

You didn't change anything. You added a speed buff to the Q and put a slow on his E, and a heal on his ult. His playstyle is the exact same. THE EXACT SAME.

I mean...i'll still play him and love it but....i was expecting at least a new passive.

replies.body:
Yes he is awesome, but his kit has little counterplay. A good Vlad is very tough for any champion to beat. 

The update did nothing to fix it. He's still very tough to lane against...let alone teamfight.

> [{quoted}](name=Raiyza,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ikr9QEio,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2016-04-19T21:20:50.865+0000)
>
> Yes he is awesome, but his kit has little counterplay. A good Vlad is very tough for any champion to beat. 
> 
> The update did nothing to fix it. He's still very tough to lane against...let alone teamfight.

I was expecting the update to increase the amount of counterplay in his kit but it looks like it reduced it. (correct me if I'm wrong)

I don't agree. The E being blockable (and having a real health cost) and the Q being weaker outside of the highly predicable buff that disappears if not used within 2.5 seconds both open up some pretty big opportunities to smack him around. I'm seeing plenty of ways that you can respond to him, limit the effectiveness of his abilities, and punish him if he plays poorly. He's definitely better than current Vlad.

Correct about the new Q. Basic Q is much weaker then live Q but the empowered Q is much stronger then live Q. There is a indicator when Vlad is about to get his empowered Q so the enemy can walk out of range and force him to use it on a minion during the 2.5 second time frame.

New E is much stronger then live E if you land a fully charged E, but much weaker if you whiff it. Also the 10% health cost (And removal of WOTA) makes the choice to use it meaningful regardless of what point in the game you are in. Rather then live E which you just spam once you get a few items.
Sounds like plenty of counterplay. Idk what OP is blabbering about.

I'm so hyped about these updates, can't wait to play with my Soulstealer Vlad and Overlord Malzahar skin again.
C:
[:

I actually agreed with the OP when I came here, but this does seem well thought out and like a very healthy change, especially to the certain game breaking lanes he could have! Thank you for the response!

The E works like a 360 degree Ashe Volley. So if you are behind minions or allied  champions you won't get hit by it. He can also charge it to pump more health into it (up to 10% max health) It does quite a bit of damage at full charge but your opponent can hide behind minions or allies or walk out of range which adds much more counterplay then his live E.
it stops regardless of whether it kills the minion or not right? it doesn't keep going like kalista Q if they minion dies?
Yup, it stops just like Ashe Volley

> [{quoted}](name=InHaruhiWeTrust,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ikr9QEio,comment-id=0001000000010001,timestamp=2016-04-19T22:19:48.860+0000)
>
> it stops regardless of whether it kills the minion or not right? it doesn't keep going like kalista Q if they minion dies?

Interesting question, but I think there will be plenty of Youtube video as soon as tomorrow to check that ;)

> [{quoted}](name=Reav3,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ikr9QEio,comment-id=000100000001,timestamp=2016-04-19T21:35:09.752+0000)
>
> The E works like a 360 degree Ashe Volley. So if you are behind minions or allied  champions you won't get hit by it. He can also charge it to pump more health into it (up to 10% max health) It does quite a bit of damage at full charge but your opponent can hide behind minions or allies or walk out of range which adds much more counterplay then his live E.

his q is still point and click on a short cooldown. so with a movment speed boost, this will cause constant ranged hit and run playstile.

ive asked this a bunch of times already and i didnt get a straight answer. which leads me to assume that none of the rework or balance team has given this actual thought. with all the new ap/hp items, and these kiting mechanics, what is being done to give melee bruisers a chance to lane agaisnt these champions.

youre not just buffing mid lane mages as an isolated group. it looks a lot like those changes massively benefit top lane mages.

laning against a ranged champion with mobility and cc as a melee bruiser is probably the most frustrating experiences you can ever imagine. for the first 15 minutes of the lane phase, youre doing nothing but trying to survive.

its not an interactive lane where you get the chance to ever trade back at your opponent. its really just making decisions if you can afford to take cs or have to let them go, because you would take too much damage from the poke of your opponent and risk feeding a kill on top of being underfarmed.

if you were ever stupid enough trying to engage, youd get slowed, or stunned and kited while the mage or adc deals damage to you and you would probably die to the massive minion wave theyre constantly pushing in against you.

i dare you to play 50 games on darius, garen, jax, trundle etc. against graves, vayne, lyssandra, vlad, gnar, swain, teemo, lulu and ryze on top.

please tell me you have at least buffs to dorans shield against ranged auto attacks and single target spells in store. or youre giving us a lvl 1 mr option than can compete with {{item:1029}} + 4 {{item:2003}} 

if we cant trade back at them, ebcause you feel the need to give them a dash and more cc on their items, then at least let us out sustain more of their poke.

Darius, Vlad and Sion are actually my mains. While I can't speak to all the top lane mages I can say that playing against new Vlad as Sion or Darius is more managable then live Vlad. It can be more punishing if he outplays you but it can also be less punishing if he doesn't.

Hi I wanted to give some small feedback on Vlad's new splashart appearance; I noticed in his splashart, in the mid year magic site, his face looks old, more wrinkled and insane, not as youthful as before. Just wanted to say that I think i prefer his young appearance (allthough the new blood stream looks good).

http://pre14.deviantart.net/20bd/th/pre/i/2013/016/9/1/vladimir__league_of_legends_by_michalivan-d5rpp44.jpg
vs
http://4.bp.blogspot.com/-f4tiqG5uBv8/UIIEOLs1NxI/AAAAAAAAJOU/Gc9v7S4FicY/s1600/Vladimir_Splash_0.jpg

Anyone has any thoughts?

MOAR BLUD
{{summoner:31}}

Ahh ok, I couldn't find the actual notes on his changes yet. Thank you.
That does tone things back quite a bit.

Frankly, I'm of the opposite point of view.

I don't think they made it so that Vlad still has the same lack of counterplay.

I think he has much more counterplay.

So much in fact, that he won't be able to reliably use his abilities on anyone good.

I think he's going to be unreliable. Which means he's bad. 

It's like Illaoi. Her damage is so unreliable that she sucks unless her numbers are insane.

Without seeing much gameplay, my first impression is that his early game will become even worst and his late game will become much scarier. Frankly, thats not a tradeoff that is worth it in this meta. Vlad still suffers from lacking a solid keystone option as well, something i was hoping his rework would finish. Geuss its still going to be Deathfire Touch..

Why isn't Deathfire good? I don't play Damage Dealers, mostly Tanks and Utility Mages, so I'm no expert about the Offensive Masteries, but to me it looks like it has crazy scalings into late game, compared to Tunderlord.

Deathfire touch is basically designed for DoT champions such as Malzahar and Brand. On those champions, its pretty good. However, you may know that Jhin also takes DFT, but he doesnt have dots, so why is that? Its because of the fact he gets much more AD than most champions, so Jhin takes it because the ability scales off AD or AP and no other stats. 

Vladimir is taking it for a similar reason due to his passive, even though the mastery honestly isnt good on him. Also, the 7% magic penetration is good since Vlad is a frontline mage, meaning he will likely be dealing with tanks moreso than squishies. Hell, DFT isnt even amazing on Jhin, its just the best choice. With so many champions who downright break and abuse masteries such as {{champion:11}} or {{champion:10}} with fervor or {{champion:57}} with grasp, its so dissapointing that this rework will still not solve Vlad's real issue; his lack of a strong keystone choice.

But DFT has no cooldown, and can be applied to the whole enemy team, and it needs barely 4 ticks (2sec) to have a better scaling than TLD (which has a 15s CD, even level 18).

So sure, it's **better** for Malzahar/Brand, but I don't understand why it's **bad** on Vlad. One Q is 4s ticks. One E is 2s, and can be applied to multiple champs. It's better than TLD, no contest. And nobody is complaining that TLD is bad.

My hypothesis is that TLD is too good during the early game (when base values are more important than scalings) and much more **visible**. You don't notice DFT damage. But it's there, clearly. The maths don't lie.

Its not "bad". Its just that Vladimir doesnt ABUSE IT like many other champions abuse their keystones. The meta at the moment is almost entirely dominated by champions who just abuse an item or a keystone. Vladimir does neither of those things, and with the rework, i dont think Vladimir will be able to abuse anything in that case. He will be okay most likely, but unless he has high numbers, he will just be "meh", like the vast majority of champions right now.

Because of several factors:

- AP ratio is bad.

- AP stacking is not easy or realistic on most AP champions. No champion can rush stack the big AP items. Many mages have to give up raw AP to get either CDR/manareg ( Lux, Syndra, Orianna ) or HP/AR/MR (Malz, Swain, Vlad, etc). The only ones that get to stack raw AP from the get to go is Katarina.

- AD ratio is high but few champions can realistically stack raw AD, basically the only one that uses it is {{champion:202}}  because of his passive.

???
dude vlad's was already fkin awesome.
we should just thanks the skies they didn't add some retarded minigames or make the q a skillshot
This was our thinking. Vlad already was strategically distinct (Uses blood for Mana.) Our goal with Vlad was just to make his kit healthier so will be easier to balance in the future.

> [{quoted}](name=Reav3,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ikr9QEio,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2016-04-19T23:34:06.300+0000)
>
> This was our thinking. Vlad already was strategically distinct (Uses blood for Mana.) Our goal with Vlad was just to make his kit healthier so will be easier to balance in the future.

what about Fiddles.

Removed a large chunk of his damage for...... situationally good movespeed?

Im not understanding how that passive is supposed to work.

Is it really just to give him a movespeed buff after channeling ult? We already had the Stormsurge mastery for that -.-.
more movespeed, the repositions will be real. actually very helpful.

Don't forget that he stands still when draining too and would thus get the movespeed when it ends (assuming he isn't hard cc'd out of it too quickly). He'd also be able to do more after draining another champ that ran out of tether range rather than his previous method of handling that situation, going back to kill non-champs. This would help him use his ult to keep up with enemies, increase the speed of his jungle clear, and assuming he stood still in the fountain long enough to regen health/mana he'd get back to the jungle much faster as well.

The reliability of the old passive was a bit odd. It basically ensured that any enemy that got damage by more than 1 tic of his W or ult would take additional damage, so Riot subsequently balanced the numbers of his abilities around that absurdly common occurrence.

If that magic resist shred was necessary to keep him relevant then I'm sure that Riot will eventually get around to it. I say "eventually", but I expect almost all champs on the update roster to receive number changes within two patches after they hit live.

well since Xypherous finally acomplished his goal, or gaveup depending on how you view it, spellvamp is gona nad he can be balanced easier anyways~.

i just remember like 3-4 years ago when WoTA had its mana regen removed for cdr i asked xypherous why it was changed, he said he has been working on fixing spell vamp itemization for a while, guess he finally realized it was impossible.

> [{quoted}](name=Kiss Kiss Kiss,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ikr9QEio,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-04-19T21:17:44.438+0000)
>
> ???
> dude vlad's was already fkin awesome.
> we should just thanks the skies they didn't add some retarded minigames or make the q a skillshot

It's sad that we have gotten to the point of just being thankfully kit reworks aren't adding pointless minigames.

it would be better if his q only stacked on champ hits. At least that way the enemy could just back off after being hit too much before it wears off.

Now it's just gold card denial and harder zoning since he will likely close the gap to q again after getting the move speed.

Let's at least see how it all pans out, but hopefully it turns out better than it looks. Still seems pretty binary (oppressive when ahead, negligible when behind)

>Now it's just gold card denial

Not really. He only has the empowered Q for 2.5 seconds before he loses it. Staying out of range for 2.5 seconds is not unreasonable.

The E being blockable by minions is a pretty big deal too. It's not hard to avoid the blast.

And if he doesn't tag you with it, he gets the movement speed buff so that he can hit you with his next q and maneuver for hitting his e.

I'm not saying he'll for sure still be an issue, but you can understand my apprehension from only seeing it on paper.

>And if he doesn't tag you with it, he gets the movement speed buff so that he can hit you with his next q 

I think you may have a bit of a misunderstanding of the skill. You only get the movement speed buff for about 1 or 1.5 seconds when the empowered Q activates. It does not activate under any other circumstances. It can help him a little bit with getting the empowered Q off on you, but it literally can not help him get a non-empowered Q onto you because it won't be there. It's not even that much for helping him maneuver his E.

I mean, you get a 10-6 second warning before his empowered Q activates, and all he gets to help him get it onto you is the short movement speed burst, and he only gets 2.5 seconds to use it before he loses the big chunk of bonus damage and healing and you get to shove it down his throat. That's not unreasonable to play around.

I can understand your apprehension, but I do think it is misplaced.

It's kind of confusing to me because according to the tooltip, Vladimir gains bonus movement speed for a maximum of 2.5 seconds when the empowered Transfusion is off cooldown, and he bonus movement speed expires once Vladimir casts empowered Transfusion as _it is not available to cast anymore_. Is the tooltip wrong or am I reading too much into it?

> Vladimir drains the lifeforce of his target, dealing 80/100/120/140/160 (+0.45) magic damage and healing himself for 20/25/30/35/40 (+0) health. After casting Transfusion twice, **Vladimir gains Crimson Rush the next time it becomes available to cast.**
>
> Crimson Rush: **Vladimir is briefly hasted** and for the next 2.5 seconds Transfusion deals 100% increased damage and heals for an additional x plus 5% (+%) of his missing health (healing halved against minions).

When you say "activate", you mean when empowered Transfusion is available to cast right?
I really wish the tooltips have more clarity, as of now some of them are just a mess to read. Sometimes I have to go through the League of Legends Wiki to see the whole picture.
It cannot keep the buff more than 2.5s every 27s, it's not really hard zoning.

So as a vlad player you aren't happy that they updated him gave him new and more fun skills while keeping him just the way you liked? Sigh you aren't a vlad player that's for sure.

Only thing to really complain about is that there isn't as much immediate sustain like what he currently has with WotA aside from that it's a wonderful rework.

And counterplay-wise there's a ton in it, stop being blind and look.

> [{quoted}](name=EcchiOtakuTM,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Ikr9QEio,comment-id=0014,timestamp=2016-04-20T06:29:07.810+0000)
>
> So as a vlad player you aren't happy that they updated him gave him new and more fun skills while keeping him just the way you liked? Sigh you aren't a vlad player that's for sure.
> 
> Only thing to really complain about is that there isn't as much immediate sustain like what he currently has with WotA aside from that it's a wonderful rework.
> 
> And counterplay-wise there's a ton in it, stop being blind and look.

New and more fun skills? Look again. They are the same skills. More fun because of the visuals and the crimson rush mechanic? Come on now. 

Don't get me wrong, I love playing current Vlad, but he's hit and run. Updated Vlad is the same thing. Riot added a couple of windows, but that's it.

So the new Q requires two casts to enable the empowered Q. All that means, is Vlad will hit some damage and then when he gets Crimson Rush, the enemy champion will be forced to back off as if Annie had her stun ready. That's poor design in my opinion. I understand that its only 2.5 seconds, but thats still a powerful tool to force lost cs. The Q should be a skillshot. That way if the enemy is alert and can dodge one Q, Vlad loses his chances at Crimson Rush.

The passive is just boring. Always has been. I was really hoping for a new one. I have proposed a few previously. 

The new E is really the only change I like because of the health cost. Now he has to think about when to use it rather than spamming it.
The one thing that dissapoints me is that an ability that can cost up to 10% of his max hp is blocked by minions.

This is actually entirely wrong. The old Vladimir would poke, hide, poke, hide, poke in lane. His Q damage and heal has been reduced to where you rely on getting the enhancement and using it ASAP in order to get real healing, so Vlad has to really work for big healing. This in itself is a play style change.

Plus now that spellvamp items have been taken out of the game, I expected some sort of compensation for such a champ that relies so heavily on sustaining. As things stand we're seeing a mage with no poke, weaker waveclear, weaker sustain, weaker harass, and maybe a bit of a stronger burst depending how much his max charged E does.

The changes only delay his dueling power. I agree with critmaster. Vlad will be hit and run, just like he is now. He's still resourceless. You can say his new Q will allow windows, but Vlad can freely cast Q all day and the enhanced one will force his opponent to back off, losing Cs. The speed boost will also fuck over any non mobile champion, pushing them even further off the game.

The new E, sure it can be dodged, but it's the same ability. It just has to charge now. 

The passive is still boring. Build one, get the other. No interaction, and no way to counter it.
I wish Vlad had old Karma's passive, it would give him more risk/reward for going low health like Mundo.
Personally I like it when they retain fundamental playstyle / feel when reworking champs.  Kit updates are usually meant for relevancy/balance

Will vlad still be able to sustain without spell vamp? Not sure about what changed in his kit to remedy that.

I was hoping for a new splash/texture update cus his base model is very static, and could look a bit more fluid. It's also a very old model. I think blood lord vlad does a good job of improving his model.

They said they would compensate for the spellvamp removal so the numbers have probably be tweeked a bit. Also you can Q more often now so their is that.

As for the model he will eventually get one and all the splash arts are getting updated.

The point was to enhance his playstyle and its distinctiveness, not significantly change his ultimate gameplay goals.

Personally, I think the updated Vlad is fucking awesome compared to Live Vlad

I am very excited, this allows him to wreak even more havoc. his ult heals him, his e damages him but is kinda like sion w which harms you to reap massive rewards, with the new rocket belt item he is gonna be a fun one, charge up, rocket boost, ult q pool and then run out, seems fun.
